item.description:
This is a beautiful trail and is relatively flat throughout and begins in Ayer, MA and ends in Nashua, NH.
You might think this is a long ride since it goes into NH but It's only 12.5 miles each way for a total of 25 miles round trip.

We won't leave the parking lot until 10am because I'm told that those who are taking the commuter rail will arrive at 9:46 and it's only 500 feet from the parking lot that we'll be at.

Last weekend I rode it with my friend Bob and enjoyed it very much.....it was a nice change from the minuteman path that we've all done so many times!

Here's the link to the site:

http://www.mass.gov/d...

Here's a link to a map of the path....

http://www.mass.gov/d...

It says at the link that it's 11 miles each way but that doesn't include the 1.5 mile extension that crosses the NH border.

I can be reached on the day of the trip at 617-894-8454 (cell)

Parking is free at the beginning of the trail.

I always recommend bringing a bike in good working condition - a tune up is worth it!
Also, bring a spare tube along with energy food and plenty of water especially since it's supposed to be warm.
item.name: Nashua River Rail Trail - Begins in Ayer MA - Weather expected to be 70's/80's
